result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel A Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Defendant is individually responsible for restitution of $4,392.95 to victims Clifford and Starr B.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution requested for American Family Insurance ($7,139.57) and Clifford B ($8,785.70) to be paid Joint and Several as a condition of probation. FINAL Restitution amount to be determined at Future Hearing.
02/23/2017 PER RESTITUTION HEARING - FINAL AMOUNTS ARE AMERICAN FAMILY, ZERO, VICTIMS $4,392.95. TO BE PAID MY MR LOPEZ INDIVIDUALLY.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the victims or their residences or with the co-actor. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

Defendant Israel A Lopez in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims Clifford and Starr B. appear by telephone.  Parties reach a stipulation as to amount that Mr. Israel Lopez owes individually  - the amount of $4,392.95 to Clifford and Starr B..  American Family sets restitution owed at -0-.

Dated 01/13/17, from the State to Judge Carter, requesting to have testimony from victims by phone.  

01/17/17, per Judge Carter: granted, any objection will be addressed at the hearing if not raised by the Defense before that.
Dated 12/28/16. Confirmation of lift of Detainer, filed by DOC.
Copy of letter dated 12/21/16 from Victim Witness Specialist to American Family Insurance regarding restitution hearing.
Detainer Lift sent to Racine Correctional
Restitution hearing on February 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Israel A Lopez in court, in custody, with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information filed today.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT

  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
         2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS     *Consecutive to present sentence*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims or their residences or the co-actor
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $7,139.57 to American Family Insurance (Joint & Several)  (RESTITUTION HEARING REQUESTED BY THE DEFENSE)
                         $8,785.70 to Clifford B. (Joint & Several) (RESTITUTION HEARING REQUESTED BY THE DEFENSE)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 120 Days straight time - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH 
 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
